alert.note: Alert for Humphreys (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 24 at 9:20AM CST until February 28 at 10:48AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Duck River Near Hurricane Mills affecting Humphreys County. For the Duck River...including Hurricane Mills...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Duck River Near Hurricane Mills. * WHEN...Until late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Portions of Tumbling Creek Road east of Highway 13 are flooded to a depth of 2 feet and may be impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 21.9 feet and rising. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CST Thursday was 21.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 23.0 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.9 feet on 01/01/1970. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 330 AM CST.
